revisions.message: install passenger module from brightbox repo, support for multiple sites

charm.description:
Phusion Passenger is an application server for Ruby (Rack) apps.
It allows you to get your web apps online with the least amount of hassle, by taking
care of pretty much all of the heavy lifting for you when it comes to managing
your apps' processes and resources.
charm.name: apache2-passenger
charm.summary: Rails and Rack support for Apache2

revisions.message: Jorge O. Castro 2012-04-03 * Update README to account for charm store being deployed
Fixed db-relation-changed, and skipped Y/n on second changes
added support for upgrading charm and removing db relation

charm.description:
AppFlower is an open source application builder for use in building web-based applications. AppFlower provides a visual designer (Studio) to develop applications without prior knowledge of programming, using drag and drop and no coding. Advanced users can create more complex applications.

- Enterprise-level application builder
- Web-based Visual Designer (IDE)
- Widget, Layout and Theme builder
- No coding philosophy
- Native REST integration for all Widgets
- Modern web 2.0 user-interface with Sencha
- RAD for web 2.0
- Open-source and Extendable (based on Symfony & Sencha)
- Integrated Debugging and Benchmarker utilities
- Large community-base with plugins from both AppFlower, Sencha, Symfony (and 3rd party php frameworks like Zend).
charm.name: appflower
charm.summary: AppFlower is a Web-based Rapid Application Builder

code_source.last_log: [hloeung,r=mthaddon] Fix error below when SSL chain certificate file is missing, and create cert from template for self-signed cert

revisions.message: [hloeung,r=mthaddon] Fix error below when SSL chain certificate file is missing, and create cert from template for self-signed cert
[wedgwood,r=mthaddon] Handle the chain file in the same way other cert components are handled

Merging MP:153721. Allow config option for providing SSL chain certificates file very much like what we have for certificates and private keys. Also fixed up so that ssl_key is ignored when ssl_cert is specified as SELFSIGNED like what the description in config.yaml says.
remove website-relation-changed hook... just do this in joined

charm.description:
The Apache Software Foundation's goal is to build a secure, efficient
and extensible HTTP server as standards-compliant open source
software. The result has long been the number one web server on the
Internet.  It features support for HTTPS, virtual hosting, CGI, SSI,
IPv6, easy scripting and database integration, request/response
filtering, many flexible authentication schemes, and more.
charm.name: apache2

config_change_command.description:
The command to run whenever config has changed. Accepted values are
"reload" or "restart" - any other value will mean neither is executed
after a config change (which may be desired, if you're running a
production server and would rather handle these out of band). Note:
some variables like the mpm settings require a restart to go into effect.

lb_balancer_timeout.description: How long the backends in mod_proxy_balancer will timeout, in seconds

logrotate_count.description: The number of days we want to retain logs for

logrotate_dateext.description: Use daily extension like YYYMMDD instead of simply adding a number

nagios_check_http_params.description: The parameters to pass to the nrpe plugin check_http.

nagios_context.description:
Used by the nrpe-external-master subordinate charm. A string that will be prepended to instance name to set the host name in nagios. So for instance the hostname would be something like:
    juju-postgresql-0
If you're running multiple environments with the same services in them this allows you to differentiate between them.

server_signature.description: Security setting. Set to one of  On  Off  EMail

server_tokens.description: Security setting. Set to one of  Full  OS  Minimal  Minor  Major  Prod

servername.description: ServerName for vhost, defaults to the units public-address

ssl_cert.description:
base64 encoded server certificate.  If the keyword 'SELFSIGNED'
is used, the certificate and key will be autogenerated as
self-signed.

ssl_certlocation.description:
Name and location of ssl certificate in charm/data directory.
If not found, will ignore.  Basename of this file will be used
as the basename of the cert rooted at /etc/ssl/certs.  Can
be used in conjunction with the ssl_cert parameter to specify
the cert as a configuration setting.

ssl_chain.description:
base64 encoded chain certificates file.  If ssl_cert is
specified as SELFSIGNED, this will be ignored.

ssl_chainlocation.description:
Name and location of the ssl chain file.  Basename of this file
will be used as the basename of the chain file rooted at
/etc/ssl/certs.

ssl_key.description:
base64 encoded server certificate key.  If ssl_cert is
specified as SELFSIGNED, this will be ignored.

ssl_keylocation.description:
Name and location of ssl keyfile in charm/data directory.
If not found, will ignore.  Basename of this file will be used
as the basename of the key rooted at /etc/ssl/private.  Can
be used in conjuntion with the ssl_key parameter to specify
the key as a configuration setting.

trace_enabled.description: Security setting. Set to one of  On  Off  extended

use_rsyslog.description: Change logging behaviour to log both access and error logs via rsyslog

- Move exec.d handling into shell land.
- Switch install hook to shell script invoking python hook.

code_source.last_log: [hloeung] Removed to avoid conflicts with the revision file in stagingstack.

revisions.message: [hloeung] Removed to avoid conflicts with the revision file in stagingstack.
Fixed lock detection as APT uses fcntl locks vs. just the existance of that file.
[hloeung] Resynchronize the package index files before trying to install packages and also commit to package cache at the end.
[hloeung] Added temporary workaround for LP: #1068624 as we're not yet running 0.7 of juju.
Added code to create file containing allowed OpenID providers and cleaned out unused code.
Add basic hooks and basic functionality to install required packages and enable required apache2 module.

charm.description:
Configures up an Apache web server enabling OpenID access control to web
resources.
charm.name: apache-openid
charm.summary: Enables OpenID on Apache web servers

revisions.message: - Force a host header equal the balancer name so that we can distinguish by domain name in squid.
- Use sitenames instead of unit name if provided
[r=spm] Fixed logger to use apache2 tag, filter based on tag, and fixed permissions for log files so the "syslog" user has access to write to. Also disable the default "It works!" website.

revisions.message: Moved hook to db-relation-changed (which is also called on join.). Renamed charm to include dashes now that postgresql charm bug is fixed.
Added static file handling for apache.
Revert charm rename - bug 893088 not fixed properly yet.
Set rev. back to 1 to share.

charm.description: Deploy your Django project as an Apache mod_wsgi app.
charm.name: apache-django-wsgi

additional-debian-packages.description:
Additional debian packages to install (eg. python-django-south). This
string will be passed to apt-get.

additional-pip-packages.description:
Additional python packages that are not yet available as Ubuntu/Debian
packages.

app-source.description:
The location of your Django application to deploy. The root
folder should contain a standard python setup.py which can be
used to install your app.

app-source-package-name.description:
The name of the python package for your app (TODO: we should extract
automatically from setup.py)

app-source-project-location.description:
The relative path within your source tree to a working project
configuration (ie. where the urls, settings, manage.py exists).
The database configuration will be overridden, as will the debug
flag. Currently this configuration information is required within
your application tree, but later we could easily support a separate
configuration branch as an alternative.

app-source-revision.description: The revision of your application to deploy.

app-source-type.description: The vcs type to which app-source refers (bzr, git, etc).

service-hostname.description: The hostname for which your service should be configured

code_source.last_log: Trying to flesh this upload script out some

revisions.message: Trying to flesh this upload script out some
Passing along the version information as well
Passing from shell to Python to talk to Cassandra
Making sure we get a DB connection before dying
Making sure the host and password make it through even if we don't have quite the right alignment of the moons
Making everything into a shared death spiral
Using the right directory for juju-send

charm.description:
Builds an Ubuntu Desktop system, logs in using the Dummy X11 driver,
and measures how long it takes for a given application to start.
charm.name: application-start

appinfo.description: Path to the application information file that describes the application whos start time should be determined.

itterations.description: Number of times to check.  Each run could yeild slightly different results do to things like caching so multiple runs are best for statistically significant results.

timeout.description: Amount of time to allow the application to startup.  We don't have a good way to detect, so we're hoping it settles in this amount of time.  Remember, keep it long becasue of Callgrind.

code_source.last_log: Made install hook look awsome by using better methods, not tested yet, use at own risk!

revisions.message: Made install hook look awsome by using better methods, not tested yet, use at own risk!
